page.title: 20THE DYSENTERY OUTBREAK
page.content: At the beginning of May.St.Philip Evans school together with Oakfield in Trowbridge were hit with an outbreak of dysentery.A high number of children were reported to have sickness and diarrhoea. Initially in St.Philip Evans,about 20 children were affected.In the infants a further 20 children were also affected.Even in the juniors 11 cases were reported.Most of these cases were in families,though several staff had to have dysentery tests. If a child was suspected of dysentery their parents were advised to take their child to the doctors and tell the doctor of the outbreak of dysentery in the school.If the tests showed symptoms of dysentry,they were advised to stay away from school for a week or two.By late June,the out break was over except in isolated cases.
